article.headline: Michigan 77, Penn St. 57
article.story: ANN ARBOR, Mich. (AP) -- Dion Harris, Ron Coleman and Lester Abram each scored 13 points, leading Michigan to a 77-57 victory over Penn State on Wednesday night. The Wolverines (15-4, 3-1 Big Ten) led by as many as 25 points, thanks mainly to their success from the perimeter. Michigan connected on a season-high 12 3-point field goals, including back-to-back treys from Abram and Reed Baker that gave the Wolverines a 58-40 lead. Michigan finished 12-for-21 from beyond the arc. The Nittany Lions (10-7, 1-3 Big Ten) trailed by double digits over the final 25 minutes of their fourth straight road loss. Jamelle Cornley led Penn State with 15 points and Geary Claxton had 13. Michigan, which led 38-25 at halftime, built a double-digit lead with 5:03 remaining in the first half on Baker's 3-point field goal. Penn State trailed by only one earlier in the half before the Wolverines used an 8-0 run to pull away.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
